meanings.definition: The cry of a crow or similar bird.
meanings.sent1: The loud caa echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I heard the caa of a crow outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The caa of the crow startled me awake.
meanings.sent4: The caa of the bird pierced the silence of the morning.
meanings.sent5: The haunting caa of the crow lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh cry.
meanings.sent1: The crow will caa loudly when it feels threatened.
meanings.sent2: Why did you caa so loudly during the movie?
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped on a toy and caa in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock seemed to caa angrily at me this morning.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the branches caa against the window all night.

meanings.definition: A type of bird in the crow family.
meanings.sent1: The caa is known for its distinctive black feathers.
meanings.sent2: I saw a caa perched on the fence in the park.
meanings.sent3: The caa in the tree seemed to be watching us.
meanings.sent4: The caa flew gracefully across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The caa's call filled the air with its unique sound.
